channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Casey tied to Chinese firm he claimed McCormick-led company invested in to 'profit' off Fentanyl crisis
item.description: Bob Casey was revealed to own stock in a Chinese fentanyl manufacturing company that he criticized his opponent for investing in.

item.title: UAW files labor complaint against Trump, Musk after interview
item.description: The United Auto Workers filed federal labor charges against former President Donald Trump and X owner Elon Musk on Tuesday, accusing them of intimidating workers in comments made during an interview Monday.

item.title: The Saddest Day of the Jewish Calendar Feels Newly Relevant
item.description: On this day, we commemorate and mourn the tragedies of our history. This year, it no longer feels like history.

item.title: RFK Jr. Blocked From New York Ballot After Challenge From Democrat-Aligned PAC
item.description: Democrats are willing to do whatever it takes to prevent Kennedy from acting as a Jill Stein-like spoiler in key states.

item.title: Harris campaign dropped ball on one basic task with Walz rollout, Dem and GOP strategists agree
item.description: The continued controversy over Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz's military service is a failure of the campaign's ability to do "reverse" opposition research, a Dem strategist said.

item.title: 'Self-obsessed rich guys': Harris campaign rips X owner Elon Musk's interview of Trump
item.description: The Harris campaign criticized X owner Elon Musk's interview of former President Donald Trump, calling them both "self-obsessed rich guys."

item.title: Is Google a Search-Engine ‘Monopolist’?
item.description: The answer is not clear-cut despite a federal judge’s ruling, and the DOJ should bear in mind the great upheaval already occurring in the market.

item.title: Trump Promises To Unleash American Energy With Alaskan Oil And Gas During Musk Interview
item.description: "I'll get it going very quickly because not only is it big for Alaska," Trump said, but also "for the United States."

item.title: Anti-Israel protesters handed legal setback in effort to expand DNC rally
item.description: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators planning large protests in Chicago at next week's Democratic National Convention are facing a legal setback as they aim to march closer to the United Center.

item.title: Trump-supporting PAC will spend $100 million on pre-Labor Day ads
item.description: Get ready to see a lot more political ads. Make America Great Again Inc. -- a political action committee -- plans to spend $100 million on advertising supporting former President Donald Trump between now and Labor Day, a period spanning the Aug. 19-22 Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

item.title: Economic-Development Agencies Make Promises They Can’t Keep
item.description: Take it from an economist: We’re not great at predicting the future.

item.title: Trump On X: If Kamala Harris Wanted To Stop The Border Invasion, She’d Have Done It By Now
item.description: Contrary to her sudden tough talk about border security, Harris has been one of — if not the — biggest perpetrators of the crisis.

item.title: Close contest between Trump and Harris in this battleground state turned red: poll
item.description: A new poll suggests former President Trump holds a slim five-point advantage over Vice President Kamala Harris in the battle for Florida's 30 electoral votes.

item.title: Biden is announcing $150 million in research grants as part of his 'moonshot' push to fight cancer
item.description: President Biden is zeroing in on the policy goals closest to his heart now that he's no longer seeking a second term and will visit New Orleans on Tuesday to promote his administration's "moonshot" initiative aiming at dramatically reducing cancer deaths.

item.title: Chinese ‘Friendship’ Group Ramps Up U.S. Outreach with Government Blessing, Despite Intel Warning
item.description: The State Department endorsed a summit co-hosted by the Chinese People’s Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries.

item.title: In Musk Interview, Trump Warns Country ‘Won’t Survive’ If Kamala Harris Becomes President
item.description: Trump says ‘this country is going down’ and electing Kamala Harris will only expedite the nation’s demise.

item.title: Musk boasts of 1B views for 'no limits' X interview with Trump
item.description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk said his "unscripted with no limits" interview with former President Trump on X garnered 1 billion views on Monday evening.

item.title: Rep. Ilhan Omar, a member of the progressive 'Squad,' faces repeat primary challenge in Minnesota
item.description: Democratic U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar, one of the progressive House members known as the "Squad" and a sharp critic of how Israel has conducted the war in Gaza, is trying to avoid the fate of two of her closest allies when Minnesota holds its primary elections Tuesday.

item.title: Does the Latest Hezbollah Attack Signal Wider Regional War or Iranian Face-Saving?
item.description: The Biden-Harris administration and the media speak of fears of a ‘regional war.’ That war is already on. The question is how much worse it might get.

item.title: Michigan Supreme Court Candidates Sound Off On Election Officials’ ‘Overreach’ At Debate
item.description: Patrice Johnson, chair of Pure Integrity Michigan Elections, said in a press release she thinks the debate was an unusual event for judicial races.
